    • Method Detail

      • addOrUpdateAssetCollection

        public void addOrUpdateAssetCollection(Map<String,Object> params,
                              ISirqulCallback<AssetCollectionResponse> callback)
        Adds or Updates an asset collection. If the "collectionId" parameter is false, this will create a new AssetCollection. If "collectionId" is a valid id, this will update that collection.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/collection

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id
        • SirqulKeys.collectionType
          the collection type
        • SirqulKeys.collectionId
          the collection id
        • SirqulKeys.title
          the title
        • SirqulKeys.coverAssetId
          the cover asset id
        • SirqulKeys.startDate
          the start date
        • SirqulKeys.endDate
          the end date
        • SirqulKeys.tags
          the tags
        • SirqulKeys.description
          the description
        • SirqulKeys.publicRead
          the public read
        • SirqulKeys.publicWrite
          the public write
        • SirqulKeys.publicDelete
          the public delete
        • SirqulKeys.publicAdd
          the public add
        • SirqulKeys.locationDescription
          the location description
        • SirqulKeys.visibility
          the visibility
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a AssetCollectionResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        AssetCollectionObject.addOrUpdateAssetCollection
